input: Bob is nice. Charlie is blue. Erin is big. Erin is white. Gary is big. Gary is green. Gary is quiet. All blue things are white. All nice things are quiet. Green, big things are quiet. If something is green and nice then it is blue. Nice things are big. If something is rough and green then it is big. White, green things are big. White things are rough. All rough, blue things are green. Question: Charlie is quiet.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Nice Bob
axiom T2 : Blue Charlie
axiom T3 : Big Erin
axiom T4 : White Erin
axiom T5 : Big Gary
axiom T6 : Green Gary
axiom T7 : Quiet Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → White x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Quiet x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ Big x → Quiet x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ Nice x → Blue x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Big x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Green x → Big x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Green x → Big x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, White x → Rough x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Blue x → Green x

theorem charlie_is_quiet : Quiet Charlie :=
begin
  apply R2,
  apply R4,
  split,
  apply R9,
  split,
  apply R8,
  apply R1,
  exact T2,
  exact T2,
  exact T2,
end

-- The answer is True
